repnme.cdata!: Brazil - Sao Paulo State Feeder Roads Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Sao Paulo State Feeder
            Roads Project for Brazil were as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, risk to development outcome was moderate, Bank
            performance was satisfactory, and Borrower performance was
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned included: the highly
            streamlined project design proved to be a valuable
            instrument and provided the right amount of flexibility in
            project implementation that was the key for the success of
            the pro-vicinais program for a sophisticated client with
            important needs. The sufficient lead-time and resources for
            consensus building and prioritization of the policy goals
            was a key to successfully introducing new management systems
            involving very complex procedural changes. The
            sustainability of the rural road asset can be enhanced
            through more active engagement of the project in assisting
            clients in supporting local governments. Standardized
            engineering designs with a classification of different
            levels of maintenance interventions based on simple road
            parameters are an important contributor for implementing
            large-scale roads rehabilitation programs rapidly and
            efficiently but without compromising quality engineering.

repnme.cdata!: Brazil - Sao Paulo Feeder Roads Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of the Sao
            Paulo Feeder Roads Project for Brazil is to improve the
            efficiency of the paved municipal road network. Efficiency
            is to be improved as a result of improvements to the
            institutional framework used by the Borrower in four key
            areas to deliver adequate transport conditions to users i.e.
            planning; environmental licensing; participation of private
            sector; and execution, combined with improvements in the
            condition of the paved municipal road network. The
            allocation is necessary for following reasons: (i)
            optimizing the use of the proceeds of the parent loan by
            distributing the unallocated amount between works,
            non-consultant services and consultant services in support
            to the state program of rehabilitation of municipal paved
            roads; and (ii) goods, non-consultant services, training and
            consultant services to support institutional strengthening
            activities mainly to the one of the beneficiary entities,
            the State Secretariat of Transport. There are no outstanding audits.
